title: Quiz 2: Traffic Rules and Right of Way
description: Test your knowledge of Kenyan traffic rules, right of way, and road safety regulations

questions.question: At a roundabout, who has the right of way?
questions.explanation: Vehicles already circulating in the roundabout have the right of way. You must yield to traffic from your right before entering.
questions.hint: Think about who is already using the road space

context.value:
ðŸ”„ Roundabout Rules

Roundabouts are designed to keep traffic flowing smoothly. Understanding right of way prevents accidents and congestion.

  • Always approach with caution
  • Signal your exit intention
  • Give way to traffic already in the roundabout

questions.question: You must always stop at a zebra crossing when pedestrians are waiting to cross.
questions.explanation: Yes, you must stop and give way to pedestrians at zebra crossings. Pedestrians have absolute right of way at marked crossings.

context.value:
ðŸš¶ Pedestrian Crossings

Zebra crossings are marked pedestrian crossing points where pedestrians have priority over vehicles.

questions.question: What is the maximum blood alcohol content (BAC) allowed for drivers in Kenya?
questions.explanation: In Kenya, the legal BAC limit is 0.08%. However, it's safest not to drink any alcohol before driving.
questions.hint: This is a legal limit, but zero is always safest

questions.question: When must you use your headlights?

options.text: Between sunset and sunrise, and in poor visibility

questions.explanation: Headlights must be used between sunset and sunrise, and during any conditions of poor visibility such as fog, heavy rain, or dust.
questions.hint: Think about when you need to see and be seen

questions.question: Which of the following are legal reasons to use your horn? (Select all that apply)

options.text: To warn other road users of your presence
To express anger at another driver
To greet friends on the street
When overtaking on a narrow road

questions.explanation: Horns should only be used to warn others of your presence, alert them to danger, or when overtaking. Using horns unnecessarily is illegal and creates noise pollution.

questions.question: What should you do when an emergency vehicle with sirens and flashing lights approaches from behind?

options.text: Speed up to get out of the way
Pull over to the left and stop when safe

questions.explanation: You must pull over to the left side of the road and stop when it is safe to do so, allowing the emergency vehicle to pass.

questions.question: It is legal to use a mobile phone while driving if you use a hands-free device.
questions.explanation: Yes, hands-free devices are legal. However, holding a phone while driving is illegal and dangerous as it distracts you from the road.

questions.question: What is the minimum following distance you should maintain behind another vehicle in normal conditions?
questions.explanation: The minimum safe following distance is 2 seconds in normal conditions. This should be increased in poor weather or road conditions.

questions.question: When are you allowed to overtake on the left side of another vehicle?

options.text: When the vehicle ahead is turning right

questions.explanation: You may overtake on the left only when the vehicle ahead is signaling and positioned to turn right, or in designated lanes.
questions.hint: Think about when it's safe and logical

questions.question: Which of the following must you carry with you when driving? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: You must always carry your driving license, vehicle logbook, insurance certificate, and valid inspection certificate when driving. Failure to produce these documents when requested by police is an offense.
questions.hint: Think about legal requirements for vehicle operation
